questions.question_text:
No More Homelessness (NMH) recently launched a public site. The Support team has received feedback that some of the articles aren't showing up in the search results for unauthenticated or guest users.

How can NMH ensure that articles are shared with all guest users?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Visible in Public Knowledge Base only applies to solutions, not articles in the public knowledge base. Reference - https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.faq_solutions_what_are_the_visible.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: C
C. Select “Visible in Public Knowledge Base” at the article level.

By selecting the "Visible in Public Knowledge Base" option at the article level, NMH ensures that the articles are accessible to unauthenticated or guest users. This setting overrides any sharing restrictions and makes the article visible to all users accessing the public site.

choices.D: Select “Public” organization-wide default for the article type at the org level.
choices.C: Select “Visible in Public Knowledge Base” at the article level.
choices.A: Create a custom profile for Public access.
choices.B: Create a custom permission set for Public access.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) is planning to create a portal for its global partner network. Users will be assigned a Partner Community license and a role.
Which two things should UC keep in mind when setting up partner roles? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Role Hierarchy can only be used if all objects have external OWD set to Private.
choices.D: Once created, roles cannot be deleted.
choices.C: The default limit for the number of roles for portals is 50,000 per org.

discussion.content:
B & C are correct.
"Roles can be deleted from any point in the hierarchy as long as a user is not assigned. If a user is assigned then, we need to move the users to a different role and then delete the role" 
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000385841&type=1

"New orgs can have a maximum of 50,000 account roles for Experience Cloud users by default."
https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/projects/communities_share_crm_data/account_roles_hierarchy

A & D are incorrect statements. The role hierarchy is generally used to open up access through the heirarchy. Roles can be deleted.

Some of these processes involve partner lifecycle management that DF is looking to automate as part of a broad digital transformation initiative.

In what three ways can Salesforce Partner Relationship Management (PRM) help DF? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BC are the correct answer

Selected Answer: CD
B is not entirely accurate because data category visibility settings are not directly inherited from the role assigned to the user's account managers. Instead, data category visibility settings are typically configured based on the user's profile or permission set.

In Salesforce, data category visibility settings determine which data categories (and their associated articles) users can view and access. These settings are typically configured at the profile or permission set level, rather than being directly inherited from the user's account managers.

choices.A: When a category is made visible to a user through custom settings or is made visible by default, its child and parent categories are not included.
choices.B: Customer Portal users and partner portal users inherit data category visibility settings of the role assigned to their account (owner) managers by default.
choices.D: Translated articles will NOT follow the original article data category. Therefore, translated articles can be assigned to a different data category.
choices.C: Child roles cannot see more data categories than their parent role. If the parent role’s visibility is reduced to be less than the child’s, the child role’s category visibility is reset to its parent s category visibility.
